sentences.en: Because even uninformed people understand how uncertain the outcomes are, fear is pervasive.
sentences.cn: 就连资讯闭塞的人也知道结果有多麽不稳定, 因此恐惧在蔓延.

sentences.en: Cases of child abuse often go unreported or ignored by uninformed citizens.
sentences.cn: 虐待儿童案件常常没人举报，或者为缺乏相关知识的公民所忽略。

sentences.en: Her colleagues had deliberately kept her uninformed.
sentences.cn: 她那些同事故意不让她知道.

sentences.en: Most uninformed computer users believe this restore disk is capable of restoring lost data.
sentences.cn: 大多数计算机用户不知情的恢复磁盘认为这是恢复丢失的数据的能力.

sentences.en: Nothing will change that outside uninformed thinking.
sentences.cn: 什么也改变不了外界的这种无知的想法.

sentences.en: Often, when the other side appears irrational, they are in fact uninformed.
sentences.cn: 通常来说, 如果对方看起来不理智, 他们实际上只是不知情.

sentences.en: Parents were left anxious, uninformed, and isolated.
sentences.cn: 家长们忧心忡忡，不知道情况到底如何，感到孤立无援。

sentences.en: Quercus , or , to the uninformed layman, the oak.
sentences.cn: 栎属乔木, 亦即外行人所谓的橡树.
来自不了解情况的新闻记者的毫无根据的批评

sentences.en: You have occasionally kept people uninformed in order to give you an advantage in some way.
sentences.cn: 你偶尔让他人不知情.以在某种程度上保持你的优势.

words.tran_cn: 无知的；未被通知的；未受教育的；不学无术的

trans.tran_cn: 信息不足的，情况不明的，未受教育的，无知的
trans.tran_en: not having enough knowledge or information
